title: Reveal a ggplot incrementally
text: ggreveal makes easy present data ggplot2 graphs incrementally. functions package take plot break series intermediary plots can shown sequence (e.g. different slides). Like :  want ? ’s fun — often useful teaching academic presentations.1

title: Reveal a ggplot incrementally
text: Create graph ggplot2 usual.  use one reveal_panels(), reveal_groups(), reveal_layers() reveal_axis() obtain list plots show elements incrementally.    probably want save graphs using reveal_save(), can easily include later presentation:
code: library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) library(ggreveal)  p <-  ggplot(penguins[!is.na(penguins$sex),],              aes(body_mass_g, bill_length_mm,                  group=sex, color=sex)) +       geom_point() +       geom_smooth(method="lm", formula = 'y ~ x', linewidth=1) +       facet_wrap(~species) +       theme_minimal() p plot_list <- reveal_groups(p) plot_list #> [[1]] #>  #> [[2]] #>  #> [[3]] reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4) ── Saving incremental plots ──  ✔ myplot_0.png ✔ myplot_1.png ✔ myplot_2_last.png

title: Reveal by aes — reveal_aes
text: #' Turns ggplot list plots, showing data incrementally arbitrary aesthetic.

title: Reveal by aes — reveal_aes
text: p ggplot2 object aes aesthetic reveal E.g.: group, colour, shape, linetype order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal levels specified aesthetic. example, aes='shape' plot uses three shapes, order = c(3, 2, 1) invert order revealed. shape included vector omitted incremental plots. E.g.: order = c(3, 1), second shape shown. default, first plot blank, showing layout elements (title, legends, axes, etc) data. omit blank plot, include -1: e.g. order = c(-1, 3, 1), order = -1. max maximum number unique levels aesthetic used

title: Reveal by aes — reveal_aes
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal by aes — reveal_aes
code: # Create full plot   p <- mtcars |>    ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,               color = factor(vs),               group = factor(vs))) +    geom_point(aes(shape=factor(am)), size=2) +    geom_smooth(method="lm",                formula = 'y ~ x',                linewidth=1)  #> Error in ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(vs), group = factor(vs))): could not find function "ggplot"  p #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'p' not found   plot_list <- reveal_aes(p, "shape") #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'p' not found  plot_list[[1]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'plot_list' not found  plot_list[[2]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'plot_list' not found  plot_list[[3]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'plot_list' not found  plot_list[[4]] #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'plot_list' not found  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4) } # }

title: Reveal plot by axis — reveal_axis
text: Turns ggplot list plots, showing data incrementally categories x y axis. reveal_x() reveal_y() useful wrappers call main function axis specified.

title: Reveal plot by axis — reveal_axis
code: reveal_axis(p, order = NULL, axis = c("x", "y"))  reveal_x(p, order = NULL)  reveal_y(p, order = NULL)

title: Reveal plot by axis — reveal_axis
text: p ggplot2 object order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal categories example, three categories axis, order = c(3, 2, 1) invert order revealed. category included vector omitted incremental plots. E.g.: order = c(3, 1), second category shown. default, first plot blank, showing layout elements (title, legends, axes, etc) data. omit blank plot, include -1: e.g. order = c(-1, 3, 1), order = -1. axis (optional) "x" "y", specify axis revealed. "x" default

title: Reveal plot by axis — reveal_axis
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by axis — reveal_axis
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(factor(vs),               color = gear,              fill= gear,               group = gear)) +   geom_bar() +   facet_wrap(~am) p   plot_list <- reveal_x(p) plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4) } # }

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: Turns ggplot list plots, showing data incrementally panels.

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: p ggplot2 object order (optional) numeric vector specifying order reveal panels example, three panels plot, order = c(3, 2, 1) invert order revealed. panel included vector omitted incremental plots. E.g.: order = c(3, 1), second panel shown. default, first plot blank, showing layout elements (title, legends, axes, etc) data. omit blank plot, include -1: e.g. order = c(-1, 3, 1), order = -1. (optional) one "data" "everything".' "data" (default), basic graph layout, including axes facet labels, shown start, data points shown incrementally. "everything", entire panels shown incrementally.

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
text: list ggplot2 objects, can passed reveal_save()

title: Reveal plot by panel — reveal_panels
code: # Create full plot library(ggplot2) data("mtcars")  p <- mtcars |>   ggplot(aes(mpg, wt,              color = factor(vs),              group = factor(vs))) +   geom_point() +   geom_smooth(method="lm",               formula = 'y ~ x',               linewidth=1) +   facet_wrap(~am) p   # Only data plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "data") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   # Everything plot_list <- reveal_panels(p, what = "everything") plot_list[[1]]  plot_list[[2]]  plot_list[[3]]   if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save plots reveal_save(plot_list, "myplot.png", width = 8, height = 4) } # }
